column4: How can I add a menu? So that I will have 'Applications - Places - System - MYMENU'
Right click on the menu, choose "edit menu"
I can then add items to 'Applications' and 'System' but pressing 'New Menu' adds a menu below 'Applications' while I want it on the same level
Ah. That I don't *think* is so easy
it should be... I tried to add a custom menu to the panel but then I get the same menu twice.
I don't think Gnome supports that without a seperate application to make the extra menu
there *is* something you can do, though
If you right click on the panel, select "add to panel"
choose the Drawer option
I have that.
Right.
I think that's the best you can do.
but then I can't seem to get a text next to the icons in that
is it posible that the drawer shows the name next to the icon?
I suspect if it can, it'll be a per-icon setting
it's just another type of panel - some of the things that are added to the panel can display as text instead (or in addition) to icons
any chance u know how? I did not seem to get it done (that's why I switched to menu)
it's an option on the individual icons, not on the drawer.
and not all will have it
basically, it's unlikely it'll do what you want.
